intro: Bembicia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the Campanulaceae family. It consists of several species native to various regions in Europe, Asia, and North Africa. These plants are characterized by their bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Bembicia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
